Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Chaim Schwartz, Rabbinical Seminary of America, 76-01 147th Street, Flushing, NY, 11367.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gennaro.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Chaim Schwartz, Rabbinical Seminary of America, 76-01 147 Street, Flushing, N.Y. 11367.

Council Member Gennaro moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 030433 MMQ, an amendment to the City Map; shall be subject to Council review.  This applications are related to applications no. C 030509 HUQ, C030510 ZMQ and C 030511 HAQ that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Amendment to City Map (C 030433 MMQ)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to oppose Section 631 of the Medicare Drug and Modernization Act of 2003, which would allow employers to eliminate or provide reduced health benefits to Medicare-eligible retirees, and further calling upon the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to reconsider its proposed amendment to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act, which would permit employers to alter, reduce or eliminate health benefits for Medicare-eligible retirees.
Items.MatterName: Congress to oppose Section 631 of the Medicare Drug and Modernization Act of 2003.

Items.Title: Resolution strongly opposing President Bush's nomination of California Supreme Court Justice Janice Rogers Brown to the Federal Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Opposing President Bush's nomination of California Supreme Court Justice Janice Rogers Brown.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the use of air conditioning systems.
Items.MatterName: Use of air conditioning systems

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad for the anti-Semitic remarks he recently made at The Islamic Summit Conference.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Denouncing former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad for the anti-Semitic remarks he recently made at The Islamic Summit Conference.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to restricting the purchase and use of sport utility vehicles by the city of New York.
Items.MatterName: Restricting the purchase and use of sport utility vehicles by the city of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to naming Veterans Way, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Veteran's Way, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the certification for the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties.
Items.MatterName: Certification for the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties ("absentee landlord tax surcharge/STAR").

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to delaying the billing for the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties for fiscal 2004.
Items.MatterName: Delaying the billing for the imposition of a real property tax surcharge on certain class one properties for fiscal 2004. ("absentee landlord tax surcharge")>

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing a fine against the owners of commercial buildings and residential buildings of six or more units who do not remove graffiti from their premises, and in relation to allowing the city to clean graffiti from these buildings without the consent of the owner of the property.
Items.MatterName: Imposing a fine against the owners of commercial buildings and residential buildings of six or more units who do not remove graffiti from their premises.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to amend the election law in relation to adding the term "domestic partner" to the list of family members one may accompany outside of the election district and be eligible to receive an absentee ballot.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to amend the election law in relation to adding the term "domestic partner" to the list of family members.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York city police department to trace all firearms in its possession and to share the results of such tracing with law enforcement agencies nationwide.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to trace all firearm in its possession and to share the results of such tracing with law enforcement agencies nationwide.

Items.Title: Resolution praising and congratulating Shirin Ebadi for becoming the first Muslim woman to win the Nobel Peace Prize.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Praising and congratulating Shirin Ebadi, Nobel Peace Prize

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to grant real property tax exemptions to owners of property for the cost of removing graffiti.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to grant real property tax exemptions to owners of property for the cost of removing graffiti.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to increase the penalty for the failure to register or verify an address as required by the Sex Offender Registration Act.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to increase the penalty for the failure to register or verify an address as required by the Sex Offender Registration Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Senate to enact S. 5329, also known as "Timothy's Law," which would provide New Yorkers with fair insurance treatment for mental health and chemical dependency services.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Enact S.5329, also known as "Timothy's Law," which would provide New Yorkers with fair insurance treatment for mental health and chemical dependency services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enforcement of the restrictions regarding engine idling.
Items.MatterName: Enforcement of the restrictions regarding engine idling.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass Assembly Bill 04440, a bill establishing a system of merit selection for judges in New York State.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a system of merit selection for judges in NYS (A.04440)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the parties designated by the New York State Board of Elections in the City of New York and holding a place on a judicial election ballot to create independent and diverse judicial screening panels that provide a meaningful evaluation process for the selection of judicial candidates.
Items.MatterName: Parties designated by the NYS Board of Elections in NYC and holding a place on a judicial election ballot to create independent and diverse judicial screening panels.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to pass legislation reforming the present judicial election process by (i) establishing a voluntary Campaign Finance Program for all judicial candidates, (ii) requiring all judicial candidates, whether inside or outside such system, to disclose contributions and expenditures and (iii) requiring the New York State Board of Elections to publish a meaningful and objective voters guide for all judicial elections.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to pass legislation reforming the present judicial election process.

Items.Title: Roll Call

Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to adopt House of Representatives Bill 303 and Senate Bill 392, which would permit retired members of the Armed Forces, who have a service-connected disability, to receive both retirement pay and disability compensation; and further calling upon the United States Congress to adopt House of Representatives Bill 2569, which, in addition to permitting retired members of the Armed Forces who have a service-connected disability to receive both retirement pay and disability compensation, would also improve other benefits for veterans and members of the Armed Forces.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Improve benefits for veterans and members of the Armed Forces (S.392, H.R. 303)

Items.Title: Resolution urging Congress to hold hearings regarding Senate Bill 1186 and House of Representatives Bill 1264, which provide for a reduction in the backlog of claims for benefits pending with the Department of Veterans Affairs, and calling upon Congress to adopt these bills as expeditiously as possible.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Reduction in the backlog of claims for benefits pending with the Dep't of Veterans Affairs

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk

The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: Int 599-A.  See files for individual votes.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 030433 MMQ, an amendment to the City Map; shall be subject to Council review.  This applications are related to applications no. C 030509 HUQ, C030510 ZMQ and C 030511 HAQ that are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Amendment to City Map (C 030433 MMQ)
